headline.main: Answers About Child Health Care in New York

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured.
docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the first set of answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System. This week, Ms. Wessler answered questions about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured. We are no longer taking questions for this feature.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured.

headline.print_headline: Diabetes Cases Increase 15 Percent In 2 Years
headline.main: Diabetes Cases Increase 15 Percent in 2 Years

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of Americans with diabetes increased by 15 percent in two years to 24 million, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. About 8 percent of the population now has the disease, mainly Type 2 diabetes, which is linked to obesity and sedentary living, the agency said in a report using data from 2007. A quarter of people ages 60 and older had diabetes, the agency said. The number of people worldwide with diabetes will double to 366 million by 2030, according to the World Health Organization, which calls the disease an epidemic. Most people with diabetes have resistance to insulin, which the body uses to convert blood sugar to energy. The C.D.C. report was its first update of the prevalence of diabetes since 2005, when it reported that about 21 million Americans had the disease.

headline.seo: Summer Is a Nutrition Challenge for Parents and Children
headline.print_headline: School Is Out, and Nutrition Takes a Hike
headline.main: School Is Out, and Nutrition Takes a Hike

docs.lead_paragraph: Camp food is just one of the summertime nutrition challenges for parents these days.

headline.seo: Drug-Resistant High Blood Pressure on the Rise, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Drug-Resistant High Blood Pressure on the Rise
headline.main: Drug-Resistant High Blood Pressure on the Rise

docs.lead_paragraph: High blood pressure, the most commonly diagnosed condition in the United States, is becoming increasingly resistant to drugs that lower it.
docs.snippet: High blood pressure, the most commonly diagnosed condition in the United States, is becoming increasingly resistant to drugs that lower it.

headline.print_headline: Waistlines Expand Into a Workplace Issue
headline.main: Waistlines Expand Into a Workplace Issue

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly two-thirds of American adults are overweight or obese, a condition for which employers, in their capacity as health insurance providers, pay heavily.
docs.snippet: Nearly two-thirds of American adults are overweight or obese, a condition for which employers, in their capacity as health insurance providers, pay heavily.
